intro: Caltha camtschatica, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Caltha camtschatica is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and delicate appearance.
